reviews.review_msg: Super nice guy, def wants the best for all his students. Beware, this course is content HEAVY. study for weeks in advance to prepare for midterms + final. follow learning objectives, understand the examples KNOW THE SCIENTISTS! AND WHAT THEY DISCOVERED cannot stress this enough lol, just memorize everything

Had Dr. Bains as an Instructor last term. I appreciated how he listened to requests/feedback and recorded live lectures (which were informative and fun).  BISC 333 is information heavy but Dr. Bains made things easier with his practice questions in lecture and student learning objectives for each topic.  I would take another course with him again!

Dr. Bains just exudes positive energy!  The way he set up the course made it easier for students to do their best such as having team assignments, individual quizzes (in which the worst mark was removed in the end), practice questions during lectures, SLOs for each lecture topic, and recorded lectures just in case students were unable to attend.

Onkar is a fantastic lecturer, and a very fair instructor overall. Bisc 333 has been content heavy, and relatively complex, but Onkar releases detailed student learning objectives for every lecture. With consistent feedback, fair marking, and all the tools to succeed, BISC333 was a breeze.

Dr. Bains is a gift from God. I have regained my drive during this semester, mostly because of this professor even without interacting directly. The quizzes and group assignments are scheduled at an optimal pace without causing stress. I never felt overwhelmed. His friendliness, and the comprehensible lectures nudged me to gladly put in the work.

All you have to do to succeed in his class is to memorize EVERY SINGLE WORD on the lecture slides. No textbook. He did give youtube videos to watch and some odd questions were from there on the midterm. He does scale but makes the midterms and quizzes and final very detail focused and on a time crunch.

Kathleen is one of the best profs I've ever had. She truly cares about students and does her best for them to learn. Unlike many courses, her exams emphasize critical thinking over memorization, so they can be challenging if you cram at the last minute. But, she is fair and adjusts the curve if the class average is low Try to learn during lectures.

Kathleen is definitely one of the worst professors you can have. It's best to steer clear of her classes. Despite reading terrible reviews, I took a chance, hoping she'd be different, but I ended up even more disappointed. She's really disorganized and focuses too much on genes instead of the bigger picture. Plus, there are no learning objectives.

Rushes through course material and then expects detail on exams. Even if you know the material inside out, she is very, very, VERY picky about exam answers so your performance on her exams won't entirely reflect what you know. Lectures are scattered and disorganized making it tough to grasp material as soon as it's taught.

Starts off nice and approachable, ends up being rude and seemingly bitter. Writes really hard, long tests and marks in a really picky manner, but does add some (ie 2-5) marks after the fact. Gave the class average for the first MT and it was around 50%, didn't release them for the next two tests (can only assume they went down).

Her midterm is LONG and UNFAIR if ur not an EXPERT in FAST WRITTING, whatever how much you know in this subject! We are not experimental bunny!!She keep changing her exams patterns, and elongate it to make students never finish it!!FINALLY, she make "ADJUST" the total marks to MAKE ONLY ONE PERSON to get 95% to get A+, is that fair??!!

This course is very difficult with loads of material to memorize. Her lectures are very informative and uses iclickers. Her exams seem fair at first but her marking is extremely picky, which makes it really hard as she wants a lot of details from you. She bases most of her notes from the book, so be sure to read it. Overall shes nice and helpful.
VERY HARD TEACHER....VERY MEAN ALSO...
Her exams are straight forward. Memorize the notes and you will do well. The best part of the course is that the exams are not cumulative. I recommend Prof. Fitzpatrick.

She is a good lecturer and has lot's of knowledge of material. Course is very heavy in content, but non-cumulative exams make it so much easier.  Exams are straightforward from her notes; no tricks.  Straight up memorizing course!
not a very interesting lecture, but hardly surprising conidering the material. very fair tests and the notes are quite good.
Very nice instructor, she is really patient toward students.

A very helpful prof who looks after her students. Exam is moderate - hard, due to a massive amount of materials, but her exams are fair. She is abit demanding on the definition part of her test. Overall, she is a great prof!

By far one of the best professors I've had.  She actually takes the feedback that students give her, and uses it to make the class better.  333 is a boring class though, but she's an excellent professor regardless.

she's awesome. does her own course evaluations before midterms and tailors reveiw sessions accordingly. lecture before midterm is review session, lecture before that is unscheduled but remains in the lecture hall if you have questions. very enthusiastic about teaching. very approachable and helpful.

Sherryl is a decent professor, however she does get far behind on lecture material somehow even though she just reads directly off the slides. Quizzes and exams are purely online which makes little sense and result in ridiculously high averages. Content can be a bit dry, but ultimately it is an interesting course and she is very nice.

3 online exams, tutorial and complicated all MC quizzes. Exams were ok but she made 3 Q's from one specific slide. a lot of useless stuff was gone over in lectures ( tissue movement) that did not show up on exam. Shes nice tho and you can get a good mark if you can understand results of experiments. Tests very specific and wants key words

As a prof shes great. reads off slides but slides have good diagrams and everything you need to know. This class just makes you use your brain too much lol. No point in memorizing anything and there's 3 exams all online and you have enough time to do em. Quizzes are complicated and i wish she would give more time for them. Material+ concepts are ok

Super nice, knowledgable, and accommodating. Questions were encouraged and met with thoughtful and kind answers. Provides comprehensive and well-organized slides (that are posted online) and engaging lectures, and exams were take-home, open-book, and fair. Would recommend a course with her to anyone!

Dr Bisgrove is a great prof. Material can appear complicated at times, but is overall straight forward and explained well by Dr Bisgrove. Quizzes were a little rushed and complicated for the time given. Exams were tedious but doable and straight forward. Can be a little picky with marks, so dont leave out details and explain your reasonings

Sherryl was such an amazing prof. 333 is a very content heavy course and there is A LOT to know. Gives short answer questions for exams ahead of time, although avgs were still in the 60's for exams because marking was super particular. Pretty hard class, but Sherryl does her best to make it easier. Wouldn't take this class with anyone else

I would suggest taking Developmental Biology with Sherryl because she doesn't emphasize memorization. Instead, her exams are experimental questions that require critical thinking. I think this is the best way to learn in comparison to straight up memorizing everything. 3 exams + 10% tutorial marks. I got a B+ with a decent amount of effort.

Dr. Bisgrove is a super-nice professor. Tests can be difficult, but developmental biology is not an easy topic. She really tests your understanding of underlying scientific principles with thoughtful questions, as opposed to rote memorization of facts that you will just forget in 6 months. The harder exam questions are given out a day in advance.

Sherryl is a great prof! She's super approachable and very helpful. Textbook is not necessary at all as she always puts all necessary info on the slides. Tests can be a little tricky because they require you to think more, not just memorize stuff. One of my favourite profs at SFU so far.

No need to buy text, since class notes are all that is testable, and they are pulled from the text anyways. Exams were very difficult, since several questions were completely incomprehensible (many people complained). Rarely able to answer questions asked in class- this is a current topics course, but doesn't seem to keep on top of research.

A nice, friendly lady. Explains the concepts well and expects you to apply the concepts on exams. It was an interesting class and she incorporated many videos and pictures to allow you to visualize what was occurring in the embryos.

This was her first time teaching Developmental Biology, and I thought she did a really good job. She usually deals with plants and fungi, so animals were a little out of her field, but she made sure we understood the concepts, and tried to get us to think about the models, rather than just having us memorize things.  Also had a great attitude :)

very soft spoken, but if you listen carefully he has a quirky sense of humour and goes off on  wierd tangents making lectures pretty entertaining. Very fair - if he tells you to read the book - READ THE BOOK and you will be good to go.

Bring a translator.  I had no clue what he was saying half the time.  Know your plants!  Exams fair, although questions can be worded pretty oddly.  Would've ended up with a better mark if he hadn't down-scaled the exam before we had written it.  University politics baffle me.
difficult to follow.  You're never sure which part of development he's starting into in his lectures.  Exams are pretty fair though
really likes plants but otherwise really cool guy

Powerpoint slides too much text... doesn't explain things too clearly... very approachable despite the fact... willing to help... looks out for those who work hard... bad thing: DOESN'T KEEP APPOINTMENTS!!
Doesn't make scheduled appointments, however the exams are a lot easier than with most profs!

Midterm average was 47% 15/45 passed. During the final exam he and the TA laughed out loud about students exams that were just handed in. Right in front of those still writing ( literally pointed at a question and said that it was supposed to be easy while laughing).

SO MONOTONE. MT was 47% avg asked if we could get part marks for some questions, was told Dr Hutter does not believe in part marks :D No clear criteria on how we were being marked
Just stay the extra semester if you need to, not worth getting a hit to ur GPA. If u think it'll be different when u take it, no it won't,TRUST

This man goes a million miles an hour (you write a sentence and look up and he's 10 slides ahead), doesn't properly explain fundamental concepts, teaches the course in a confusing and convoluted order, and doesn't explain his grading scheme well. The class average on the midterm was 47% and this is a class of all biology major students! Never again

Dr. Hutter is an approachable, friendly, and patient professor. However, his lecture recordings were extremely unclear and hard to follow, especially towards the end of the course. His exams were extremely difficult and seemed to ask questions beyond the realm of what we undergrad students were able to understand.

This class was quite difficult, as their was a lot material in each lecture, but the slides were also quite bare so it is important to attend the lectures. His exams and quizzes were fair, but also quite difficult. Overall, he did a great job teaching the course and I would recommend you take this course with him.

Dr. Hutters lectures are informative and contains all the information you need to know without going into too much details. The materials for this course is difficult on its own, but his teaching style makes it easy to understand. Harald is a very nice and caring person so if you are having trouble, talk to him and he will help you!

AVOID IF YOU CAN!!! Very dull, monotonous lectures crammed with extra info not in the textbook, but expected to know. Condescending and dismissive. Expected us to complete a midterm in 45 minutes, which the entire class took 5 hr+ & had a low average. Made course harder than it needed to be, expects students to have PhD level of knowledge on topic.
Monotoned and lecture slides contains just bare minimum. Makes you feel dumb for asking questions and doesn't provide a straight answer.
great prof. exams are fair, available to help. Took other classes with him because I enjoy his teaching style.
He is very monotonous. It is really hard to follow along in the class. The concepts are hard and he barely explained things in detail. The class was not structured well either. Would not recommend.

Harald was a great prof, although a very monotone lecturer, the course content is very interesting and his lecture notes have the information that you need for exams, and he was very clear to students what would be examinable and what wasn't. The textbook is only recommended but I found it really helpful for the final that was 60%.

Harald was not bad. I found him to be a very monotone speaker so lectures were always a bit dry, but he did present the information in new and interesting ways which kept them engaging. The final was worth 60% of the overall grade which was nervewrecking but he provided lots of feedback, resources, and clear grading criteria so the class was good!

All in all a pretty good experience with this class. Make sure you come to lecture as his lecture notes are just pictures without context. This is not an easy class but he does a pretty good job explaining concepts. you get a free 15% for weekly assignment completion and Iclicker. The course was fairly interesting as well, would recommend.

Whie his lecture notes are not super clear, Harald Hutter is very approachable and does his best to make sure students understand. His tests are fair and does not throw curve balls. If you read the textbook or study in advance you will do well. Be sure to go to the TA's for challenging concepts!

This is not an easy class by any means but I love the way that Dr. Hutter teaches. He doesn't care if you know the small details, his goal is for you to understand the big picture. He doesn't have office hours but the TA for my course (Zeena) was unbelievably helpful because he is very clear with her what he wants from us.

Great prof and does his best teaching a class that has a large learning curve.  Tutorials and the TA were very helpful and free marks to boost you're grade.  Definitely had to use the text book.  Focus on what he tells you is important because there's a lot of material but a lot of it is not tested.

Harald's voice is very monotone making it difficult to pay attention in class. His final is worth 60% and the first midterm was difficult as his questions are solely conceptual. Would not recommend taking the course with him.
As long as you know and understand the material you will be good. Exams are fair and not tricky, lot of memorization but interesting course.

A teacher who listens to his students. Many kids failed his midterm in my class, and it tried his best to make it easier for them to get a great mark. Went out of his way to make the course easier and the final was stupidly easy. Excellent professor who listens to feedback and cares about his students.

Nice guy, but simply has no idea really of how to teach. Lectures, notes and the textbook do not confer a level of understanding necessary to do well on the exams. Furthermore his exams are solely conceptual, yet he spends most of his time harping on useless facts during lecture. I would not recommend this class for anybody who doesn't need it!

Great professor! Try to pay attention to his lecture.  He speaks in a very boring tone but if you actually listen to what he says its really interesting and informative.  Exams are fair and he does tend to tell you exactly what he'll ask. His notes are very useful and barely read the textbook and just used his notes to study.

The lectures were okay but the notes were great.  I recommend going through the figure captions in the text book (as the figures in his notes are all out of the text) if things are a little confusing.  The tutorials were very useful and definitely worth attending (plus a big chunk of my grade was on homework completion, you just have to try!)

Dr. Hutter's lectures can be boring due to his monotone voice but his notes are very clear and detailed. His exams are quite fair (he tells you pretty much what questions he is likely to ask) and they come straight out of the lecture notes and problem sets.
Disastrous class! Monotone lectures were very hard to understand. Notes are dry & unclear, and the material itself is quite difficult...plus he's no help.
No Comments
No Comments

Textbook needed b/c notes are scattered! Monotone voice. Tough midterms due to vague questions and an incredibly strict marking criteria. So unless you're a psychic: good luck deciding what he wants as an answer! Spent a whole lecture telling us that without understanding the material we will continue to do badly on his exams. Quite condescending.

She goes very fast through the material and reads straight from the slides. There's a lot of information in her lectures and it's very disorganized. She seems nice and willing to help students learn, but sadly, it doesn't make up for not being very organized and clear. She's enthusiastic, but it's hard to follow what she's saying.

Lisa is friendly and easy to talk to. I appreciated that she included summaries or learning objectives on her slides, which were really helpful for studying. However, she can be a bit disorganized and often just reads from the slides.
AWESOME!
He is boring, Weird, and tries to be funny. He stares alot in a awkward way. Teaching is very boring, its hard not to fall asleep. Tests are ridiculous, I advise people not to take BISC333 with him.
Very clear, incredibly available to help students.  it's rare to get a prof who is so good at actually teaching the stuff they study.  Highly recommended.

Extremely helpful. Great notes! great lecturer. Funnnnny guy! he records the lectures which is really a big help. his little caption notes on pp sldes are super helpful! exams were fair but the course is hard! I wish he would teach more upper devision classes! Nick, if ur reading this, I'm giving you a chili pepper...and i'm a guy ;)

AWESOME and BEST Prof I've ever had! He's super funny and not rude at all (Why are people saying he is rude?) Includes all he plans to say in his slides, gives TONS of help if you need and goes the extra mile for his students. The only difficult thing about BISC333 is that the volume of info is huge but put in some effort and you'll do really well!

Nick is one of the best prof's you'll ever have at SFU.  Sure the material in the course is VERY tough, but Nick goes above and beyond to make sure his students get it.  He's also a really funny guy, which makes classes tolerable.  Overall I would highly recommend taking a class with him.  Very approachable and flexible in terms of office hours.

If you put in the effort you will do well; a great prof who goes the extra mile for his students. He puts a huge amount of time into this course with great slides, extra study guides and good tutorial set ups. Highly recommended!!

His slideshows are very detailed - the textbook might be nice as supplementary reading, but it is not necessary. His lectures are clear, interesting and humorous. His tests are long, but fair. The course is information heavy, but he makes it as painless as possible! Recommended!

I found him to be quite rude to students in class. However, he was very helpful outside of class and wanted his students to do well. I would not take another class from him. I found his exams to be unfair for the amount of time given, and offered students an unfair advantage for showing up early.
Rude.

He is an excellent professor!  His exams are challenging but completely fair, and he is very accessible for extra help.  He is also really nice and approachable.  I strongly recommend taking a class with him.  He is the best biology prof I have ever had.

AMAZING PROF! Best MBB and Bisc prof at the university so far. Notes are thorough,does podcasts and tests are fair. You do need to put the work in (its challenging stuff) but he couldn't be any more fascilitating, encouraging or helpful. You'd be a fool not to take his classes if you're fortunate enough to catch him
